title: C04-1011

sentences.text: We consider the problem of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance , also called the relative entropy , between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton .
We show that there is a closed-form -LRB- analytical -RRB- solution for one part of the Kullback-Leibler distance , viz the cross-entropy .
We discuss several applications of the result to the problem of distributional approximation of probabilistic context-free grammars by means of probabilistic finite automata .

Entity-the_problem_of_computing.label: the problem of computing
Entity-the_problem_of_computing.description: The challenge of calculating the Kullback-Leibler distance, also known as relative entropy, between probabilistic context-free grammars and probabilistic finite automata.

Entity-we_discus.label: We discuss
Entity-we_discus.description: The discussion of various practical uses and implications of a closed-form solution for the cross-entropy part of Kullback-Leibler distance between probabilistic context-free grammars and finite automata.

Entity-several_application_of_the_result.label: several applications of the result
Entity-several_application_of_the_result.description: Applications of a closed-form solution for computing Kullback-Leibler distance between probabilistic context-free grammars and probabilistic finite automata.

Entity-the_cross-entropy.label: the cross-entropy
Entity-the_cross-entropy.description: The concept or metric that represents a specific part of the Kullback-Leibler distance between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton.

Entity-relative_entropy.description: A measure of the difference between two probability distributions.

Entity-result.label: result
Entity-result.description: A finding or conclusion drawn from a process, investigation, or analysis.

summary: We consider the problem of computing the Kullback-Leibler distance , also called the relative entropy , between a probabilistic context-free grammar and a probabilistic finite automaton . We show that there is a closed-form -LRB- analytical -RRB- solution for one part of the Kullback-Leibler distance , viz the cross-entropy . We discuss several applications of the result to the problem of distributional approximation of probabilistic context-free grammars by means of probabilistic finite automata .

Predicate-computes.label: computes
Predicate-computes.description: Computes refers to a process or operation that involves calculating, processing, or generating information from one or more inputs. It implies a transformation of data into a new form, often involving mathematical or logical operations.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a relationship of possession or association between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the properties or attributes described by the object.

Predicate-is_also_called.label: is also called
Predicate-is_also_called.description: The predicate 'is also called' indicates a synonymic relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has an alternative name or term that is equivalent to, but not necessarily identical with, the object.

Predicate-and.label: and
Predicate-and.description: The predicate 'and' indicates a conjunction or relationship between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that they share common characteristics, properties, or features. It implies an equivalence or similarity between the subject and object, often used to describe a connection or association between abstract concepts.

Predicate-has_a_solution_for.label: has a solution for
Predicate-has_a_solution_for.description: The predicate 'has a solution for' indicates that there exists an approach or method (the subject) that can effectively address or resolve a particular problem or challenge (the object).

Predicate-is_approximated_by_means_of.label: is approximated by means of
Predicate-is_approximated_by_means_of.description: The predicate 'is approximated by means of' indicates a relationship between two formal systems or models where one system (the subject) can be effectively replaced, simplified, or reduced to another system (the object), often for computational efficiency, analytical tractability, or theoretical insight. This connection implies that the properties and behaviors of the subject are preserved in some sense by the object, allowing for a more manageable representation or approximation.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. In other words, it denotes a hierarchical relationship where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
